snippet: Facebook’s $1 billion acquisition of the mobile start-up Instagram is motivating the tech world to shift its focus to mobile from computers, with some asking: Who needs the Web?
abstract: Facebook's $1 billion acquisition of the mobile start-up Instagram underscores how the momentum in the tech world is shifting to mobile from computers; the Instagram deal has prompted many start-ups to not only prioritize mobile services, but also to question whether Web services are even necessary at all.
lead_paragraph: Facebook’s $1 billion acquisition of the mobile start-up Instagram is motivating the tech world to shift its focus to mobile from computers, with some asking: Who needs the Web?

headline.seo: Instagram Deal Is Billion-Dollar Move Toward Cellphone From PC
headline.main: A Billion-Dollar Turning Point for Mobile Apps
headline.print_headline: A Billion-Dollar Turning Point for Mobile Apps
